intro: Campium ovatum, commonly known as the common campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a biennial or annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm. The plant features showy pink or white flowers that bloom in summer, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
